snippet: The benefits of human genome sequencing may be enhanced with detailed blood tests — as found in a case study involving a geneticist’s own Type 2 diabetes.
abstract: Anne Eisenberg Novelties column suggests that the benefits of genome sequencing may be enhanced with detailed blood tests--as found in an unusual case study published in Cell involving geneticist Michael Synder’s own Type 2 diabetes; says the business of personalized genomic medicine has long been expected to blossom as low-cost sequencing of the human genome becomes available.
lead_paragraph: The benefits of human genome sequencing may be enhanced with detailed blood tests — as found in a case study involving a geneticist’s own Type 2 diabetes.

headline.seo: Geneticist’s Research Finds His Own Diabetes
